titleStmt.title: Tentamina elegantiarum bina: or, Two essays of elegancies in order to the bringing of scholars, after they can read and write true grammatical Latin, to a full and clear understanding and writing of terse and polite Latine. Principally intended for accomplishing the more adult youths in the frree-school at Newark upon Trent. By John Twells, school-master. Licensed, March 17. 1685[/]6. Rob. Midgley.
titleStmt.author: Twells, John, b. 1651 or 2.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by T.M. for Benjamin Crayle, at the Peacock and Bible at the West end of St. Pauls in Ludgate-street,

notesStmt.note: Scholastick prolusions to the art of oratory has a separate divisional title page; pagination and register are continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the West end of St. Pauls in Ludgate-street
